oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ service, 1995 December 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hood, Ralph W.; Williamson, W. Paul (William Paul)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Video recording of a service opening with testimony and a sermon by Carl Porter. His sermon ends with singing led by Porter and music by Billy Lemming. As Porter sings, Junior McCormick takes a serpent from it’s enclosure and handles. He is quickly followed by Bully Summerford and Paul Roberts. Glen Adkins takes up a serpent and sings as he handles. The music dies down and Carl Porter speaks again to the congregation while handling a serpent. Music begins again and Bill Pelfrey handles a large serpent as music lead by Joyce Summerford continues. She sings as congregants gather at the pew to pray and dance. Carl Porter gives another sermon. The sermon is succeeded by several fellows of the church testifying. Their testimony ends the video.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Appalachian Region, Southern -- Religious life and customs; Dance -- Religious aspects; Expository preaching; Extemporaneous preaching; Imposition of hands; Lay preaching; Pentecostal preaching; Prayer; Singing -- Religious aspects; Snake cults (Holiness churches) -- Appalachian Region, Southern; Witness bearing (Christianity)
Adkins, Glen; Dunn, Rayford; Lemming, Billy; McCormick, Junior; Nietzel, Brandon; Pelfrey, Bill; Porter, Carolyn; Porter, Carl; Roberts, Paul; Sherbert, Gene; Summerford, Billy; Summerford, Joyce
Church of the Lord Jesus Christ (Kingston, Ga.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Church of the Lord Jesus Christ recordings and photographs
Ralph W. Hood and W. Paul Williamson field recordings, interviews, and photographs
